msItem.title: Maṣḥafa meśṭir pp. 11-400 and 1bis-315bis
msItem.note: Introduction, pp. 11-19; on the heresy of Sabellius, pp. 19-37; on a heresy of Apollinarius, pp. 38-53; on the heresy of Arius, pp. 54-80; on the heresy of Nestorius, pp. 81-115; on the heresy of Photinus, pp. 116-160; on a heresy of Origen, pp. 161-171; on the heresy of those who say that the Word of God was transformed to be flesh, blood, bone, hair, and tendon, pp. 171-180; on the heresy of those who say that the existence of the holy spirit is after the baptism of Christ, pp. 181-185; homily on Mary entitled "The white bird with silver wings and a golden torso", pp. 185-196; on the heresy of Bitu, pp. 197-223; against the Antidicomarianites, pp. 224-235; homily of Retu'a Hāymānot to strengthen the faithful in their belief in Jesus Christ, pp. 235-255; homily of one of the orthodox of Ethiopia on the footwashing, pp. 255-266; on the heresy of Eutyches, pp. 266-288; on the heresy of Severos of India and Theodosios of Alexandria, pp. 288-298; on another heresy of Apollinarius, pp. 299-312; on the heresy of Eutychius, pp. 312-342; on the heresy of Mani, pp. 342-353; on the heretics who teach that Christ descended to hell in soul and flesh, pp. 353-396; on the heresy of Leo, pp. 3bis-47bis; against the Council of Chalcedon, pp. 48bis-60bis; against the Phantasiasts, pp. 61bis-77bis; against those who believe that children receive their souls forty days after birth, pp. 77bis-91bis; on another heresy of Origen, pp. 91bis-114bis; against those who do not believe in the transformation of the bread and wine, pp. 114bis-142bis; homily on the Ten Commandments, pp. 142bis-203bis; against those who believe that the soul dies with the flesh, pp. 204bis-241bis; on the heresy of Flavian, pp. 242bis-255bis; on the heresy of Macedonius, pp. 255bis-292bis; against those who follow the teaching of the Sadducees, pp. 293bis-314bis;

supportDesc.foliation: Numbered 11-400 and 1-329, with numbers 74-75 and 229-232 of the first series omitted, 320-321 of the second series following 323, and numbers 322 and 323 of the second series duplicated

handDesc.handNote: Ma[mmerē] ራደ ፡ አስረስ Rāda Asrass (baptismal name ሠርፀ ፡ ድንግል) of Makāna Iyasus in Gondar (cp. EMML 1146) for liqa śelṭānāt ሀብተ ፡ ማርያም, p. 316bis

origin.origDate: 9 Ḫedār 1961 EC. The date of the original composition is given on p. 315 bis in different calendars - 27th of Sanē of the Evangelical year, 10th year of the reign of Emperor Yeshaq (=June 21, 1924 A.D.) assuming that the reign of Yeshaq began in 1414.
